Article Title: IPL 2025: Digvesh Rathi given strict punishment for send-off to Priyansh Arya in LSG vs PBKS
Article Text:
Lucknow Super Giants' Digvesh Rathi with teammates celebrates the wicket of Punjab Kings' Priyansh Arya during an Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 in Lucknow. (PTI)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Lucknow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Singh has been fined 25 percent of his match fees and received one demerit point for violating the IPL Code of Conduct during Tuesday's match against Punjab Super Kings in Lucknow.The violation occurred when Singh gave a send-off to Punjab Kings batter Priyansh Arya after dismissing him in the third over.The IPL issued a statement late Tuesday addressing the incident: "Digvesh Singh, Bowler, Lucknow Super Giants has been fined 25 per cent of his match fees and has also accumulated One Demerit Point for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team's match against Punjab Kings at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow on Tuesday.""Digvesh Singh admitted to the Level 1 offence under Article 2.5 and accepted the Match Referee's sanction. For Level 1 breaches of the Code of Conduct, the Match Referee's decision is final and binding," the statement further added.Punjab Kings emerged victorious in the match, successfully chasing down the target of 172 runs with 22 balls remaining and securing an eight-wicket win.Prabsimran Singh led the chase with an explosive 69 runs off 34 balls, including three boundaries and three sixes.Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer contributed significantly with an unbeaten 52 runs from 30 balls, concluding the match with a six.Lucknow Super Giants, who batted first, posted a total of 171 for 7 wickets, which proved insufficient against Punjab's strong batting performance.
Article Summary: Lucknow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Singh fined 25 per cent of his match fees. Singh received one demerit point for violating the IPL Code of Conduct. Singh gave a send-off to Punjab Kings batter Priyansh Arya after dismissing him in the third over.

Article Title: IPL 2025: RCB look to roar louder in home comfort against Gujarat Titans
Article Text:
Andy Flower and Virat Kohli (Photo Credit: RCB video grab)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

BENGALURU: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), perennial slow starters and a side that has too often flattered only to fizzle when it matters, have been a revelation in this Indian Premier League (IPL) so far. As beginnings go, theirs has been pristinely new.Under new captain Rajat Patidar, they have begun impeccably, notching up big wins against Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings. They now have a more balanced side with a competent bowling attack — a bugbear in previous years — complementing a confident batting unit.RCB play the first of their home matches against Gujarat Titans at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Wednesday and, given how often they have let down fans, it’s hard not to conjure up the fate that befell their women’s team recently. After a sizzling start in the Women’s Premier League, the defending champions led by Smriti Mandhana lost four consecutive matches at home and crashed out in the league phase.Although the men don’t play that many home matches on the trot, they will have to tread carefully at their home ground, a known batting paradise given its small boundaries.One of their biggest assets is the new-ball bowling pair of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Josh Hazlewood, old warhorses intimately familiar with conditions in Bengaluru. The city holds a special place for Bhuvneshwar, who cut his teeth in T20 international cricket at this venue against Pakistan in 2012.Hazlewood has been immaculate in the two games so far in the 18th edition of the IPL, a luxury that has helped Patidar channel his bowling options around the veteran Australian. Apart from the seasoned pacers, RCB have the option of playing either Yash Dayal (most likely) or Rasikh Salam. RCB’s all-rounders Krunal Pandya, Liam Livingstone and Suyash Sharma for the crux of their spin department.RCB’s batting lies in its top-order led by the red-hot Phil Salt and Virat Kohli, who is still warming up to the league. With in-form skipper Patidar offering stability, Devdutt Padikkal, Jitesh Sharma and Tim David lend depth to the line-up which will be a worry for any opposition.The Titans, on the other hand, have had a mixed start to their campaign. After a heartbreaking 11-run loss to Punjab Kings in the opener, they recovered to outplay Mumbai Indians by 36 runs in Ahmedabad over the weekend.Helmed by the ‘prince’ of Indian cricket, Shubman Gill, the Titans have a potent batting line-up which includes Sai Sudharsan, Gill, Jos Buttler, Shahrukh Khan, Rahul Tewatia and Sherfane Rutherford. If the RCB bowlers are to have an off-day, Titans have enough ammunition to light up the compact stadium.At the Chinnaswamy, RCB will be wary of the Titans’ bowling attack. Mohammed Siraj has spent the better part of his IPL career at the venue before the Bengaluru outfit let go off him before the mega auction. Then, there is the expertise of home boy Prasidh Krishna and the experience of Ishant Sharma to go with the class of Kagiso Rabada. With Rashid Khan and Sai Kishore also in the frame, the Titans have a better spin attack compared to the hosts.
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have been a revelation in this Indian Premier League (IPL) so far. Under new captain Rajat Patidar, they have begun impeccably, notching up big wins against Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings. RCB play the first of their home matches against Gujarat Titans on Wednesday.

Article Title: Ashwani Kumar scripts history with record-breaking IPL debut for Mumbai Indians
Article Text:

NEW DELHI: Mumbai Indians ’ young left-arm pacer Ashwani Kumar made an unforgettable IPL debut against Kolkata Knight Riders on Sunday, delivering a record-breaking performance at the Wankhede Stadium. Kumar’s sensational 4 for 24 helped MI bundle out KKR for just 116 in 16.2 overs — the lowest total in this IPL season.The 23-year-old from a town called Jhanjeri, near Chandigarh, became the first Indian to take four wickets on an IPL debut, etching his name in the history books. He joins an elite list of bowlers with standout performances on their first IPL outing, including Alzarri Joseph (6/12) and Andrew Tye (5/17).Also See: MI vs KKR Live Ashwani struck with his very first ball in the IPL, dismissing KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane. His spell, complemented by Deepak Chahar’s 2 for 19, dismantled KKR’s batting lineup, with Angkrish Raghuvanshi top-scoring for them with 26 off 16 balls.Reflecting on his debut, an elated Ashwani said, “I felt very good, there was pressure but the team environment helped me to settle down. I didn’t have lunch today, I only ate a banana, there was some pressure so I didn’t feel hungry. The captain, Hardik bhai, told me to bowl it into the wicket and back my skills. Everyone back in my village will be watching me play, and I’m very happy.”With just four senior T20 matches, two Ranji Trophy, and four List A games under his belt before this, Ashwani’s impact on debut signals a bright future ahead for the young pacer and Mumbai Indians.
Article Summary: Ashwani Kumar becomes first Indian to take four wickets on an IPL debut. The 23-year-old took 4 for 24 on his debut against Kolkata Knight Riders. His spell helped MI bundle out KKR for just 116 in 16.2 overs.

India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has been ruled out of Mumbai Indians ' first home game of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 season against defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai today. The star pacer is yet to fully recover from the back injury that has sidelined him from competitive cricket since January this year.Mumbai Indians, who have had a slow start to their campaign, are currently at the bottom of the IPL 2025 standings after losing their first two matches. However, there is still no sign of their bowling spearhead Bumrah rejoining the squad anytime soon.Also See: MI vs KKR Live Bumrah's last competitive match was the fifth Test against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground in January 2025, where he bowled only in the first innings. He was initially named in India's provisional Champions Trophy 2025 squad but was later replaced by Harshit Rana due to concerns over his fitness.The 31-year-old has been undergoing rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru, where he has resumed bowling in the nets. A viral video showing Bumrah practicing in the nets recently sparked speculation about his return, though no official confirmation has been provided by Mumbai Indians or the BCCI "Bumrah has started bowling at the NCA. Don't know when he will get the clearance, but feeling better after watching this clip," read a social media post dated March 30, 2025.His absence has been a major setback for Mumbai Indians, who lost their first two matches — against Chennai Super Kings by four wickets on March 23 and against Gujarat Titans by 36 runs on March 29. While he is missing today’s match, reports suggest Bumrah might return to action by mid-April.Bumrah made his IPL debut with Mumbai Indians on April 4, 2013, against Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, where he took three wickets for 32 runs in four overs. Over the past 12 years, the Ahmedabad-born pacer has played 133 IPL matches, claiming 165 wickets, and remains one of only four bowlers in IPL history to have taken two five-wicket hauls.

Article Title: 'I wasn't feeling well': Nitish Rana reveals Rahul Dravid's call before match-winning knock against CSK
Article Text:

NEW DELHI: Rajasthan Royals ' batter Nitish Rana played a game-changing knock against Chennai Super Kings at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati on Sunday. His 36-ball 81 propelled RR to a formidable total, which they successfully defended to register their first win of the IPL 2025 season.Following the match, Rana disclosed that he had been unwell and had missed practice. However, a phone call from Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid provided him with the motivation he needed, especially as he was informed that he would be batting at number three.Also See: MI vs KKR Live Score "Yesterday, Rahul sir called me, and I wasn't feeling well, so I didn't go for practice. He called me to tell me that I will be batting at number 3. And I am always ready for these challenges. I enjoy the feeling when someone banks on me and shows confidence, and I like taking responsibility," Rana revealed in a video posted by Rajasthan Royals on their official social media handle.Despite struggling in his first two games, Rana was determined to turn things around. He emphasised that high-pressure situations are part of the IPL, and he was eager to contribute to RR's success."High pressure is there in all 14 games since this is the number one league in the world. And as a batsman, as a player, that pressure is always there whether you are coming after a win or a loss. Those two points were very important. We should've had those points from the very start, but that's okay. There were a lot of positives from the last two games, and we learnt a lot from those games," he stated.Rana also explained how he visualised his approach for the game after Dravid's call, helping him execute his match-winning performance."So when he [Dravid] said that, I spoke to myself about the kind of shots I can play on this wicket that would help my team. When it's your time to make runs, you'll make runs. I was trying in the first two games, but the truth is that when you come with your game plan, it gives you the edge," he added.
Article Summary: Nitish Rana played a game-changing knock against Chennai Super Kings. His 36-ball 81 propelled RR to a formidable total, which they successfully defended. Rana disclosed that he had been unwell and had missed practice. However, a phone call from Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid provided him with motivation.

NEW DELHI: Punjab Kings secured their second consecutive victory in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025, defeating the Lucknow Super Giants by eight wickets on Tuesday.Captain Shreyas Iyer continued his impressive form, notching his second consecutive half-century and leading Punjab to a comfortable win with 22 balls remaining.Sent to bat first, Lucknow struggled to establish a strong foundation, losing early wickets and reaching a final total of 171/7 in their allotted 20 overs. Punjab's bowling attack, spearheaded by Arshdeep Singh 's impressive figures of 3/43, effectively restricted Lucknow's scoring opportunities.Despite losing Mitchell Marsh for a golden duck and captain Rishabh Pant for a meager two runs, Lucknow found some stability through a 31-run partnership between Aiden Markram (28) and Nicholas Pooran (44).However, it was the partnership between Pooran and Ayush Badoni (41) that truly resurrected the innings.Late cameos from David Miller (19) and Abdul Samad (27) helped Lucknow surpass the 150-run mark.Punjab's chase got off to a flying start, courtesy of opener Prabhsimran Singh's blistering 69 off 34 balls. Singh and Iyer combined for a dominant 84-run partnership in just 44 balls, effectively dismantling Lucknow's bowling attack.Although Singh fell to wrist spinner Digvesh Rathi (2/30) in the 11th over, the damage had been done.Iyer continued his aggressive approach, reaching his half-century off just 30 balls, smashing three fours and four sixes in the process.Impact player Nehal Wadhera provided the finishing touches, smashing an unbeaten 43 off 25 balls, including four sixes. Together, Iyer and Wadhera forged an unbeaten 67-run partnership off just 37 balls, sealing a comprehensive victory for Punjab.This win propels Punjab Kings to second place in the points table, trailing only the Royal Challengers Bengaluru on net run rate.Lucknow Super Giants, on the other hand, find themselves in sixth place after this defeat. Iyer's consistent batting form, coupled with the explosive starts provided by Prabhsimran, marks Punjab as a team to watch in this edition of the IPL.ALSO SEE: Prabhsimran Singh's marauding knock, Arshdeep Singh's three-wicket burst help PBKS sink LSG

Article Title: Pakistan cricket team slapped with fine vs New Zealand - Here's why
Article Text:
Pakistan have been fined 10 percent of their match fee for a slow over-rate in the first ODI against New Zealand, as they fell two overs short. Mark Chapman's 132 and Daryl Mitchell's 76 helped New Zealand post 344, which was enough for a 73-run victory as Pakistan collapsed from 249/3 to 271 all out.

Pakistan have been fined 10 percent of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate in the first One-Day International against New Zealand at Napier on Saturday."Jeff Crowe of the ICC Elite Panel of Match Referees imposed the sanction after Mohammad Rizwan ’s side was ruled to be two overs short of the target after time allowances were taken into consideration," the ICC said in a release on Tuesday.As per Article 2.22 of the ICC Code of Conduct for Players and Player Support Personnel, which pertains to minimum over-rate offenses, players are fined five percent of their match fees for every over their side fails to bowl within the allotted time.Rizwan accepted the offense and the proposed sanction, eliminating the need for a formal hearing. The charge was leveled by on-field umpires Chris Brown and Paul Reiffel, third umpire Michael Gough, and fourth umpire Wayne Knights.Mark Chapman played a career-best knock of 132 off 111 balls to steer New Zealand to a 73-run win in the first ODI at McLean Park. His brilliant innings, coupled with Daryl Mitchell’s gritty 76 and Muhammad Abbas' record-breaking debut fifty—the fastest-ever by a batter on debut—helped the hosts post a formidable 344.Pakistan looked on course to chase down the target for a large part of their innings. Babar Azam’s fluent 78 and Salman Agha’s explosive fifty put them in a commanding position, but a dramatic collapse saw them lose seven wickets for just 22 runs, crumbling from 249 for 3 to 271 all out.Meanwhile, New Zealand will be without Chapman for the second ODI in Hamilton on Wednesday after he sustained a right hamstring injury while fielding in the first match. A subsequent MRI scan confirmed a grade one tear, requiring a short rehabilitation period.Top-order batter Tim Seifert will replace Chapman in the squad for the Hamilton ODI. Seifert joins the team after a stellar T20I series against Pakistan, where he finished as the leading run-scorer with 249 runs at an average of 62.
Article Summary: Pakistan fined 10 percent of their match fee for slow over-rate in first ODI. Mark Chapman's 132 and Daryl Mitchell's 76 helped New Zealand post 344. Pakistan collapsed from 249/3 to 271 all out, losing seven wickets for 22 runs. New Zealand will be without Chapman for second ODI in Hamilton.

Article Title: IPL 2025 crorepatis who have been a royal disappointment

Rishabh Pant and MS Dhoni (Image credit: BCCI/IPL)

- LSG (Matches: 3 | Runs: 15)

Bombay Sport Exchange Episode 1: Interview with Sanjog Gupta, CEO (Sports) at JioStar

NEW DELHI: Every year, franchises spend massive amounts on players to secure their services. While some players shine, others fail to live up to expectations. Even renowned names sometimes find themselves on the list of underperformers.This season's IPL is no exception, with a few big names making it to that unwanted list.The costliest player of the IPL 2025 mega auction Rishabh Pant, is struggling to find form with the bat. Bought for a staggering Rs 27 crore by Lucknow Super Giants and entrusted with the captaincy, Pant has failed to deliver as expected. In three matches so far, he has managed only 15 runs at a disappointing average of 7.50.Former Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma, the most successful skipper in the franchise’s history with five IPL titles, was retained for Rs 16.30 crore ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction. However, his form has been disappointing for the team. In the three matches he has played so far, Rohit has managed just 21 runs at a dismal average of 7.00.The explosive left-handed opener Abhishek Sharma is known for his aggressive starts, often giving his team a flying start from the word go. However, that hasn’t been the case for the Sunrisers Hyderabad star this season. His bat has yet to catch fire, as he has managed just 31 runs in three matches at an average of 10.33. he was retained by Sunrisers Hyderabad for a whopping Rs 14 crore for IPL 2025.KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer was the third most expensive player in the IPL 2025 Mega Auction. After playing a crucial role in KKR's title-winning IPL 2024 campaign—scoring 370 runs, including four half-centuries—the franchise bought him back for Rs 23.75 crore. However, Iyer has struggled this season, managing just 9 runs in three matches at a disappointing average of 4.50.The mention of Rinku Singh instantly brings back memories of his five breathtaking sixes in IPL 2023. Renowned for his game-changing batting, Rinku is struggling to find his rhythm this season, failing to connect the way he is known for. His poor form is a major concern for KKR, who are languishing at the bottom of the table with just one win in three matches. Retained for Rs 13 crore ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction, Rinku has managed only 29 runs in as many games.The explosive young left-hander Yashasvi Jaiswal is known for providing a solid foundation with his aggressive stroke play. A dependable opener, he has struggled to find his rhythm this season. With scores of 1, 29, and 4 in three matches, Yashasvi has failed to make an impact in the Powerplay. Retained for Rs 18 crore ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction, his form remains a concern for his team.Chennai Super Kings retained the legendary Mahendra Singh Dhoni for Rs 4 crore ahead of the IPL 2025 season, using the "uncapped player" rule, which permits teams to retain players who haven’t represented India internationally in the last five years. At 43, Dhoni remains a fan favourite, but his dip in form and struggles to finish games have raised concerns about his impact. CSK have managed just one win in their three matches so far.
Article Summary: Rishabh Pant was the costliest player of the IPL 2025 mega auction. He has managed only 15 runs at a disappointing average of 7.50 in three matches. Venkatesh Iyer was the third most expensive player in theIPL 2025 Mega Auction.

Article Title: 'Ashwani Kumar turned down job offer to fight for spot in Punjab team'
Article Text:
Ashwani Kumar (BCCI Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Bombay Sport Exchange Episode 1: Interview with Sanjog Gupta, CEO (Sports) at JioStar

NEW DELHI: As Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) openers Sunil Narine and Quinton de Kock walked out to bat in their IPL 2025 match against Mumbai Indians (MI), fans anticipated a flurry of boundaries. Former England captain Eoin Morgan had earlier described the wicket at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium as a "batter's paradise," further raising expectations.MI were winless in IPL 2025, having lost both their matches up to that point. However, what followed was a stunning display by the MI bowling attack, which dismantled KKR for just 116 runs in 16.2 overs. This dominant performance was spearheaded by debutant Ashwani Kumar , who made an immediate impact by dismissing KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane with his very first IPL delivery.Also See: LSG vs PBKS Live The left-arm pacer picked up four wickets in the match, becoming the first Indian ever to claim four dismissals on IPL debut.Interestingly, the 23-year-old had played only four senior T20 matches before facing KKR.While Ashwani has had a remarkable start to his IPL career, his journey to this stage has been anything but easy. The pacer hails from Jhanjeri, a small town near Chandigarh in Punjab."Ashwani made his debut for Punjab in 2019. However, he was sidelined for three to four years due to multiple injuries. The intense competition for opportunities in the Punjab cricket team further limited his game time. Despite these setbacks, he never lost heart and kept working hard to make a mark as a cricketer," former Punjab cricketer Mandeep Singh said in an exclusive interaction with TimesofIndia.com."Ashwani comes from a very humble background, yet he regularly traveled to Mohali for practice. His determination was evident when he turned down a job opportunity in 2024 that would have provided financial stability but required him to leave Punjab. He told me, 'I am eager to fight on and play for Punjab. I don't want to give up.' His performances in Punjab’s domestic T20 league, Sher-E-Punjab, last year proved to be a turning point, as he impressed many with his death bowling and composure under pressure," added Mandeep, who played alongside Ashwani in Sher-E-Punjab.Former Team India batter and Punjab cricket team's head coach Wasim Jaffer praised Ashwani’s ability to seize opportunities."Ashwani comes from a very humble background. He knows he has to perform whenever given a chance to fit into the Punjab team, considering the presence of players like Arshdeep Singh and Gurnoor Brar. He also understands that opportunities will be limited. I’ve told him, ‘You need to be prepared. As and when the opportunity comes, you need to strike.’ He has taken that advice seriously and works really hard. A lot of credit to him for making the most of his IPL debut," Jaffer said."Ashwani can bowl at 140 kph, making him a potent bowler. He can generate quality movement and execute yorkers and bouncers astutely. Beyond that, he has an excellent attitude—he bowls tirelessly in the nets without ever complaining about workload or limited game time. He is eager to learn, and I hope he continues to perform well for MI," Jaffer added.While Ashwani was lethal against KKR, his bowling wasn’t always as effective."I worked on Ashwani's action and helped remodel it because he struggled with line and length. The modifications have improved his accuracy and consistency, making him more effective. After the match against KKR, we spoke about the importance of staying focused rather than getting overwhelmed by success. He has faced numerous struggles—cricket is an expensive sport, and even affording good shoes can be challenging. But Ashwani has handled these hardships with great maturity," said his coach Varinder Singh.Ashwani finished with figures of 4/24 against KKR—an achievement he had seemingly manifested, as revealed by former SRH cricketer and Punjab all-rounder Sanvir Singh."Before the tournament, we discussed how his IPL debut should play out. Ashwani said that picking three wickets while conceding under 30 runs would make it a dream debut. His dream and manifestation actually came true. MI head coach Mahela Jayawardene personally watched Ashwani bowl during the trials and decided to pick him in the player auction. I’m glad things are working out well for him," Sanvir said.
Article Summary: Ashwani Kumar becomes first Indian to take four wickets on IPL debut. The 23-year-old had played only four senior T20 matches before facing KKR. Former Team India batter and Punjab cricket team's head coach Wasim Jaffer praised his ability to seize opportunities.

Article Title: Erling Haaland Manchester City striker set for lengthy absence with ankle injury

Manchester City's Erling Haaland reacts after sustaining an injury during the FA Cup quarterfinal match between Bournemouth and Manchester City. (AP)

Manchester City 's star striker Erling Haaland sustained an ankle injury during Sunday's FA Cup quarter-final victory against Bournemouth, forcing him to take a break as the season approaches its crucial phase. The 24-year-old Norwegian will undergo specialist consultation to determine the full extent of his injury.Haaland, who had just netted his 30th goal of the season to equalise in the match, was injured following a challenge with Bournemouth's Lewis Cook. The injury occurred in City's 2-1 victory."The expectation is that Erling will be fit in time to play a further part in the remainder of this season, including this summer's FIFA Club World Cup," the club stated in an official announcement."Erling underwent initial tests in Manchester on Monday morning and will now seek specialist consultation to confirm the full extent of the injury.
